events.originalText: The Maltese journalist and anti-corruption activist Daphne Caruana Galizia was killed in a car bomb attack in Bidnija.
events.subtitle: Daphne Caruana Galizia
events.headline: Daphne Caruana Galizia killed in car bomb attack in Bidnija

events.originalText: In Laos's deadliest air accident, Lao Airlines Flight 301 crashed into the Mekong River, resulting in the deaths of all 49 people aboard.
events.subtitle: Lao Airlines Flight 301
events.headline: Lao Airlines Flight 301 crashes into Mekong River, killing all 49 aboard

events.originalText: A man drove his vehicle through the window of a Luby's Cafeteria in Killeen, Texas, and opened fire, killing 23 people before fatally shooting himself.
events.subtitle: Luby's
events.headline: 23 killed in shooting at Luby's Cafeteria in Killeen, Texas

events.originalText: The Bill debuted on ITV, eventually becoming the longest-running police procedural in British television history.
events.subtitle: The Bill
events.headline: ITV's The Bill debuts, becomes longest-running police procedural in British TV history

events.originalText: With the success of ProjectÂ 596 (mushroom cloud pictured), China became the world's fifth nuclear power.
events.subtitle: Project 596
events.headline: China becomes fifth nuclear power with success of Project 596

events.originalText: A  four-day air battle over Taiwan ended with a decisive American victory, destroying hundreds of Japanese aircraft and military facilities.
events.subtitle: Formosa Air Battle
events.headline: American victory in air battle over Taiwan destroys hundreds of Japanese aircraft

events.originalText: The Holocaust: The Gestapo conducted a raid on the Roman Ghetto, capturing 1,259 members of the Jewish community, most of whom were sent to Auschwitz.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Gestapo raid on Roman Ghetto captures 1,259 Jews sent to Auschwitz

events.originalText: Roy and Walt Disney founded the Disney Brothers Cartoon Studio in Hollywood, which eventually grew to become one of the largest media and entertainment corporations in the world.
events.subtitle: Roy O. Disney
events.headline: Disney Brothers Cartoon Studio founded in Hollywood

events.originalText: Margaret Sanger established the United States' first family planning clinic in Brooklyn, New York.
events.subtitle: Margaret Sanger
events.headline: Margaret Sanger establishes first family planning clinic in Brooklyn, New York

events.originalText: Authorities of the British Raj partitioned the Bengal Presidency, separating the largely Muslim eastern areas from the largely Hindu western areas.
events.subtitle: British Raj
events.headline: Bengal Presidency partitioned by British Raj

events.originalText: Brigham Young University, the largest religious university in the United States, was founded in Provo, Utah.
events.subtitle: Brigham Young University
events.headline: Brigham Young University founded in Provo, Utah

events.originalText: The Church of Scotland established Queen's College in Kingston, Ontario, in Canada.
events.subtitle: Church of Scotland
events.headline: Church of Scotland establishes Queen's College in Kingston, Ontario

events.originalText: Most of the Palace of Westminster in London was destroyed in a fire caused by the burning of wooden tally sticks.
events.subtitle: Palace of Westminster
events.headline: Palace of Westminster in London destroyed in fire

events.originalText: The Sixth Coalition attacked French forces led by Napoleon in the Battle of Leipzig, the largest conflict in the Napoleonic Wars, with over 500,000 troops involved.
events.subtitle: War of the Sixth Coalition
events.headline: Sixth Coalition attacks Napoleon in Battle of Leipzig with over 500,000 troops

events.originalText: War of the First Coalition: The two-day Battle of Wattignies concluded with Jean-Baptiste Jourdan leading French forces to victory over Prince Josias of Saxe-Coburg-Saalfeld.
events.subtitle: War of the First Coalition
events.headline: French forces led by Jean-Baptiste Jourdan victorious in Battle of Wattignies

events.originalText: Jadwiga (pictured) was officially crowned as "King of Poland" instead of "Queen" to reflect the fact that she was a sovereign in her own right.
events.subtitle: Jadwiga of Poland
